intro: Thymophylla villosula, commonly known as the hairy thymophylla, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in humid forests and is adapted to low-light conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
